com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Class BaseGroupRenderer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseRenderer
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseGroupRenderer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, GroupRenderer, LegendInfo, Renderer
public class BaseGroupRenderer
extends BaseRenderer
implements GroupRenderer

This class uses a java.util.ArrayList for the underlying collection of sub-Renderers. No synchronization of method calls is performed here, so if you need to synchronize, you must take care of it in your calling code.

See Also:
GroupRenderer

draw

public void draw(Graphics2D g,
                 QueryFilter q,
                 int p)
          throws InterruptedException
for multipass, this method calls each sub-Renderer's draw() in turn. For single-pass, this method just invokes BaseRenderer's draw() and manages the sub-Renderers elsewhere - within through the drawCursor() method

Specified by:
draw in interface Renderer
Overrides:
draw in class BaseRenderer
Parameters:
g - the graphics context
q - the Query
p - the DrawPhase
Throws:
InterruptedException - thrown if the drawing is cancelled
See Also:
Renderer.draw(java.awt.Graphics2D, com.esri.mo2.data.feat.QueryFilter, int)

drawFeature

public void drawFeature(Graphics2D g,
                        Feature feature,
                        int phase)
                 throws InterruptedException
this method is normally only called within single-pass mode. It invokes each sub-Renderer's drawFeature() method in turn.

isRendered

public int isRendered(double scale)
Description copied from interface: Renderer
determines if any or all parts of this Renderer are rendered at the given map scale

Specified by:
isRendered in interface Renderer
Overrides:
isRendered in class BaseRenderer
Parameters:
scale - -- the map scale to test (you can obtain this from ui.bean.Map.getScale())
Returns:
0 == nothing rendered (there are scale dependent renderers). 1 == some, but not all parts are rendered (there are scale dependent renderers), 2 == all parts are rendered (there are scale dependent renderers), 3 == all parts are rendered (there are no scale dependent renderers).
See Also:
Renderer.isRendered(double)
